intro: [WRONG START] Hieracium aurantium subsp. tephranthelum, commonly known as the orange hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its bright orange flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun. It has basal leaves that are broadly lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. This subspecies is noted for its distinctive coloration and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
